thread.title: Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan
thread.title_full: Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan

author: Detroit Free Press
title: Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan
text:
Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan Metro Detroiters could see highs in the mid-60s today and Thursday, but heavy thunderstorms could sweep through Friday Post to Facebook Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan Metro Detroiters could see highs in the mid-60s today and Thursday, but heavy thunderstorms could sweep through Friday  //on.freep.com/2m80HL6   4   Two days of record heat could hit southeast Michigan Perry A. Farrell , Detroit Free Press Published 10:56 a.m. ET Feb. 22, 2017 | Updated 2 hours ago Metro Detroiters could see highs in the mid-60s today and Thursday, but heavy thunderstorms could sweep through Friday Buy Photo Nikk Baxter, 27, of Fenton enjoys the 64 degree day at Pontiac Lake Recreation Area in Waterford on Saturday, Feb. 18, 2017. (Photo: Eric Seals/Detroit Free Press) Buy Photo 53 CONNECT 4 COMMENT EMAIL MORE 
Time is running out for firing up the grill in shorts and a t-shirt. 
Metro Detroiters could see record-breaking temperatures over the next two days, with highs in the mid-60s. After that, it's back to normal for late February into early March. 
The high today is expected to reach at least 64 degrees. The record of 65 was set back in 1930, said Mike Richter of the National Weather Service in White Lake Township. 
“It’s going to be in the vicinity (record high), so we’ll have to watch it," Richter said. “It’ll be right at the edge. Tomorrow’s (Thursday) record high was 59. Because the record high is lower tomorrow; our high is expected to be 60. So it’ll be a little bit cooler, but because the record high is lower I think we’re going to be in that territory. 
"So yes, near record highs both days."
